gw.transaction

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.transaction.Transaction

  • public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class used to get the current transaction bundle or to start a new bundle transaction.
    Author:
    dbrewster

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Transaction.BlockRunnable
      A runnable block of code for a Bundle Transaction.
      static interface  Transaction.RunnableWithException
      A runnable block of code that can throw an Exception

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transaction

        public Transaction()

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrent

        public static Bundle getCurrent()
        Returns the current transaction bundle. If the current transaction isn't set then null is returned.

        Many execution contexts contain a default bundle (PCF files, non-validation rules, background processes, web services, etc...).

        Returns:
        the current bundle

      • runWithNewBundle

        public static void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block)
        Runs the specified block using a new bundle.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to run
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there isn't an active user

      • runWithNewBundle

        public static void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block,
                                    User user)
        Runs the specified block using a new bundle with the given user set as the active user.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to run
        user - the user to run as

      • runWithNewBundle

        public static void runWithNewBundle(Transaction.BlockRunnable block,
                                    java.lang.String username)
        Runs the specified block using a new bundle with the user identified by the given username set as the active user.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to run
        username - the username to run as
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no user with the given username is found

      • newBundle

        public static Bundle newBundle()
        Creates a new entity bundle. This is an alternative to runWithNewBundle(gw.transaction.Transaction.BlockRunnable) for cases when the caller needs more control over when, if ever, the bundle is committed.

      • asUserOnlyExecute

        public static void asUserOnlyExecute(@NotNull
                                     @NotNull User user,
                                     @NotNull
                                     @NotNull Transaction.RunnableWithException block)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This will only execute the block as the given user. Note that when this is later committed it will be committed with the previous service token. This permits a section of customer code to be executed with a different permission to retrieve beans that it normally shouldn't. For example if the document permissions are such that the super user can not see sensitive documents, this permits the mail system to use the email creator to retrieve the document for sending to the customer.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to use for these queries
        block - the block to execute
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the block throws an exception
